title: Sydney kidnapping spree shocks city | 7NEWS
description: Two separate kidnapping cases have shocked Sydney, with police arresting suspects in both incidents.   A 53-year-old man was rescued after being held hostage for 50 hours, with a 16-year-old boy arrested in connection with the crime.   Two men have also been charged with the murder of 85-year-old Chris Baghsarian, who was mistakenly kidnapped from his North Ryde home, tortured and killed. title: Perth grandfather survives direct lightning strike | 7NEWS
description: A 78-year-old Perth grandfather survived a direct lightning strike while walking his daughter's dog in Hammersley during a violent summer storm that produced over a thousand lightning strikes across the city. The bolt killed the dog, Messi, and left Michael Day with burns to his chest and leg, exploding his phone and destroying his clothing. The same storm system caused two teenage girls to be struck by lightning at a school in Mount Helena, knocked out train services, cut power to homes, and sparked a house fire in Nolamara. title: AI cameras catch kids with incorrect seatbelts | 7NEWS
description: New AI safety cameras on Western Australian roads are detecting hundreds of drivers daily whose passengers, particularly children, are not wearing seatbelts correctly. Parents are receiving $550 fines and eight demerit points when children move their seatbelts, even momentarily, with approximately 80% of detected offences involving incorrectly worn seatbelts rather than unclipped ones. The Road Safety Commission is now focusing on education as parents express frustration over the strict enforcement, particularly in cases involving neurodivergent children with sensory issues.
